title: Project-Based Learning for Educational Software Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts and foundational understanding of pedagogy
context.additional_context: Team Project-Centered Learning Environment Combining Instructional Design and Software Development Principles. Integrates Online (Lectures, Resource Sharing) and Offline (Workshops, Team Collaboration) Activities

learning_goals: Learners can integrate instructional design principles (e.g., ADDIE model) with agile development methodologies to design and develop educational software processes

In 4-person teams, learners conduct needs analysis for 10 learners using educational needs assessment tools (surveys, interviews), develop an educational prototype (syllabus or activity design) based on the results, and complete testing via peer evaluation and expert review (meeting at least 3 of 5 checklist items).
Learners can implement and present educational software considering accessibility, usability, and evaluation systems.

resources: Instructional Design and Software Engineering Textbook (Online Open Source)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
